column4: hi. Quick Question: Can i use ubuntu server on a machine with two CPUs? will they both be used?
make sure you're using an SMP kernel tho
is that one on a regular ubuntu server 10.04?
it should be.  if you liveboot, 'cat /proc/cpuinfo' and if you see more you're good
why dualcore? do you mean that that is good or not? i guess he uses now both CPUs, right?
rule of thumb for servers - if it aint broke, dont apt-get upgrade
allready know that... i am just always afraid of security...
don't be.  only allow the ports required
yeah, but the ports are a thing for the NAT, not for ubuntu server, right?
is this an internal server or an outward facing one?
only update the necessary packages of the services that are exposed to the outside world

if you have ssh available outside, make sure your /etc/ssh/sshd_config is locked down.  if you use apache, make sure httpd.conf is locked down.  update just those packages if those are the only ones being accessed.
also, if you offer ssh I would make it jailed shell only
what do you mean with lock sshd_config?
make sure you deny root and only allow certain users to login.  that way if there's any rogue accounts active, they cannot be accessed
